image.altText: An older man wearing a suit adorned with military medals looks stands in a military museum.

props.synopsis: Private Norden was posthumously Australia's highest military honour nearly half a century after he ran into enemy fire in Vietnam.

title.children: Friends and family criticise 'debacle' behind awarding Victoria Cross to Private Richard Norden

image.altText: Tony wears a dark green cap, red polo and grey hoodie and sits in a chair with his kitchen behind him looking out the window

props.synopsis: Tenants in two capital cities are paying more than 30 per cent of their income, on average, towards their rent — for the first time since the SGS Economics Rental Affordability Index was first published a decade ago.

title.children: Rental affordability improves in the ACT, defying national trend

image.altText: A group of people holding signs and flags walk in a protest rally.

props.synopsis: Staff at the Australian National University have overwhelmingly voted to reject a proposal from the institution to forgo a pay rise

title.children: ANU staff reject proposal to forgo pay rise as part of university's effort to turn around financial issues

image.altText: A drawing of an apartment building next to a tree

props.synopsis: The new development will include a pool, but it will be indoors and 25 metres long, which has not come as good news to everyone.

title.children: Aging Phillip pool to be halved in size as part of Geocon's planned residential development

image.altText: Cannabis Hackett 5

props.synopsis: Police arrest a man and seize 164 cannabis plants from an alleged grow house in suburban Canberra.

title.children: Police arrest Canberra man and seize 164 cannabis plants from Hackett grow house

image.altText: Pankti Bhavsar

props.synopsis: The new BAPS Mandir in Taylor is an important meeting place for Canberra's growing Hindu population — and it was the personal sacrifices from those within the community that have made this dream a reality.

title.children: This new temple in Canberra is more than a building — for some it's a 'purely living entity'

image.altText: A Woolworths branded trolley connected to a Coles branded trolley.

props.synopsis: 'Colesworth', a portmanteau referring to the perceived duopoly of supermarket retailers Coles and Woolworths, is the Australian National Dictionary Centre's Word of the Year for 2024.

title.children: Word of the Year reflects increasing frustration with Australia's top supermarkets

image.altText: Three tents under a tree in a park.

props.synopsis: A crisis accommodation centre manager in southern NSW says families are living in tents due to a lack of suitable housing.

title.children: Tents handed out to southern NSW families fleeing domestic violence

image.altText: Generic picture of Australian bank notes

props.synopsis: A former Labor treasurer has hit back at criticism of the government's plan for a $230 billion fund to favour investment in housing and renewable energy as "desperate". Follow live.

title.children: Former treasurer hits back at 'desperate' claims Labor politicising Future Fund

image.altText: Professor Stephen Wilson

props.synopsis: Professor Stephen Wilson told a nuclear committee he had received no funding from coal companies. The committee has written to the Institute of Public Affairs fellow to ask if that's true, which he has affirmed to the ABC.

title.children: Pro-nuclear professor linked to Coalition questioned over possible coal industry funding, which he denies

image.altText: Richard Marles in Question Time

props.synopsis: Despite being deputy prime minister, Richard Marles's profile is much lower than that of Treasurer Jim Chalmers, the candidate considered most likely to succeed Anthony Albanese as Labor's leader.

title.children: Richard Marles plays a dead bat on nuclear as the government rushes to get through late work

image.altText: a woman with blonde hair looking serious

props.synopsis: Women are the fastest growing cohort of prisoners in the NT. But with domestic violence one of the main drivers of female offending, some experts say many of the women being locked up, shouldn't be behind bars at all.

title.children: Women in prison 'forgotten' in national conversation on domestic and family violence, advocates say

image.altText: Three tall, modern apartment towers with a CBD skyline in the background.

props.synopsis: Apartment buildings in NSW could be inspected without a warrant and unit owners could be compelled to hand over documents under proposed new laws targeting owners corporations who do not fix common property.

title.children: 'Extraordinary intervention' into private property allowed under proposed NSW strata laws

image.altText: A group of young men in AFL jerseys sit together on steps for a photo

props.synopsis: The 2024 AFL draft has been completed, with all 18 clubs adding to their lists with players they hope will be stars of the future. Here's who your club selected and what it means for your team.

title.children: How did your club fare at the AFL draft? Every team's haul analysed

image.altText: Woman holds back due to pain

props.synopsis: A former insider calls it the "side hustle" of Australia's superannuation funds – where the handling of thousands of death and disability claims from injured workers and grieving families falls to underpaid, overworked staff away from the main game.

title.children: Super fund 'side hustle' leaves workers waiting on insurance payouts

image.altText: Heavy rainfall has caused flash flooding in areas of the southern Gold Coast.

props.synopsis: More than 170 millimetres of rain drenched areas of Queensland overnight, with the Bureau of Meteorology warning parts of the state are "near saturation".

title.children: Man clinging to tree rescued from floodwaters as heavy rainfall continues across Queensland

image.altText: Protesters hold Gautam Adani and Narendra Modi faces

props.synopsis: From a shy school dropout to one of India's richest and most influential people, Gautam Adani has now been accused of bribery by US prosecutors.

title.children: From shy school dropout to billionaire accused of bribery: Who is Gautam Adani?

image.altText: A teenager holding a mobile phone up to hide his face

props.synopsis: Immigration law experts argue the changes could have serious implications for the rights of detainees.

title.children: Mobile phones could be confiscated from immigration detainees under new Home Affairs proposal

image.altText: A woman speaking in front of a microphone.

props.synopsis: Coles is fronting up to the ACCC's supermarket inquiry once again. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Coles bosses face ACCC supermarket inquiry, answer questions on landbanking

image.altText: defence_fyre2

props.synopsis: Defence businesses say the conference was "an embarrassment" after none of the advertised officials turned up.

title.children: Defence companies claim Adelaide conference was the 'Fyre Festival' of the military world

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Louise Manning thought she knew how to handle the risks of online scammers — but it took one simple question from someone she thought was her friend to be duped.

title.children: A simple text message is allowing scammers to take control of social media accounts

image.altText: people on platform with trains.

props.synopsis: The NSW government and Rail, Tram and Bus union have set a two-week deadline to resolve an industrial dispute that nearly brought Sydney's train network to a standstill.

title.children: Sydney rail strike averted for now, but businesses and commuters have already faced 'huge impact'

image.altText: banana duct taped to a white wall

props.synopsis: It's that time of the week again. Think you've been paying attention to the news?

title.children: Weekly news quiz: ARIA Awards, Word of the Year and a banana taped to a wall

image.altText: A school of hundreds of sardines in the ocean.

props.synopsis: A study last year identified a sardine population stretching from NSW's south coast to Tasmania could rival the biggest fishery in Australia — and there's a push to make use of it.

title.children: 'Exceeded our predictions': Potentially one of the largest fisheries in Australia is sitting offshore, untapped

image.altText: Bolsonaro gesturing with the peace sign in both hands next to a polling booth

props.synopsis: Brazil's federal police have formally accused former president Jair Bolsonaro and 36 others of being involved in a coup attempt after he lost the 2022 presidential elections.

title.children: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro formally accused of coup attempt after 2022 loss

image.altText: A middle aged man with dark hair, wearing glass, dressed in a suit, in conversation with someone.

props.synopsis: Troy Thompson has been suspended as Townsville's mayor for 12 months on full pay. He says he will fight to clear his name and refutes "any and all allegations that have been made to date".

title.children: Suspended Townsville mayor vows to clear his name amid ongoing investigation into military history

image.altText: A composite image of a Japanese man, with a pair of rainbow socks and grey hoodie.

props.synopsis: Can clothing disrupt a fair trial? That's a question before the courts in Japan.

title.children: Cover that rainbow: Japanese lawsuit challenges the right of judges to police clothing

image.altText: A man in a grey black suit and glasses smiles for a photo

props.synopsis: In a statement, the mining company confirmed "all three employees are safe and well and have departed the country".

title.children: Mali government releases Resolute Mining CEO and other executives after $US160 million ransom paid

image.altText: A number of people gather outside of a hospital, next to an ambulance, at night time.

props.synopsis: Women and children are among the dead after gunmen opened fire on passenger vehicles in north-western Pakistan.

title.children: Dozens killed and injured in shooting attacks in Pakistan's north-west

image.altText: a crashed motorbike

props.synopsis: A motorcyclist who suffered lifelong injuries after losing control on loose gravel has won a legal test case allowing him to claim third-party damages worth $13.5 million.

title.children: Injured motorcyclist awarded $13.5 million because council didn't have 'loose gravel' warning signs

image.altText: Donald Trump advertised the 'presidential' guitars for up to $US10,000 ($15,000) on his social media site Truth Social.

props.synopsis: From steaks to cryptocurrency, president-elect Donald Trump has profited off an eclectic array of MAGA merchandise for years.

title.children: Trump's eclectic MAGA merchandise expands with $15,000 'presidential' guitars

image.altText: Two Australian Davis Cup players jump into each other in celebration on court after winning a vital match.

props.synopsis: Wins for Thanasi Kokkinakis and the doubles duo of Matt Ebden and Jordan Thompson power Australia past USA into the Davis Cup semi-finals.

title.children: Kokkinakis, doubles duo stun US to put Australia into Davis Cup semifinals

image.altText: An aerial shot of the Sunshine Coast Indoor Sports Centre

props.synopsis: Growing uncertainty over the Sunshine Coast's flagship basketball stadium has been pounced upon by the Gold Coast, which says it is ready to host more Olympic events.

title.children: Gold Coast poised to poach Olympics events from Sunshine Coast amid stadiums delay

image.altText: Lauren poses for a photo in a garden wearing a pink dress

props.synopsis: Lauren Ash had been considering weight loss surgery when she heard about a friend taking Ozempic. She says the weight loss has improved her life, but there have been some challenges.

title.children: 'My food noise disappeared': How taking Ozempic has changed life for Lauren
